title: ID Font Help
content:
Could any kind soul tell me what font this may be? Specifically the text that says “comic book shop.” Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [10\_mikeyburtoncnj1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105808/http:/typophile.com/files/10_mikeyburtoncnj1.jpg) | 113.95 KB |
author: ShallowRoots

comments.content:
The angle and blurriness don’t help, but [A.G. Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105808/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-be/) looks close. I suspect some other Grotesque/Gothic choices would too (those aren’t the best letters for ID purposes). For example [Trade Gothic Bold Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105808/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/trade-gothic/) also seems close.

- Mike Yanega

Not sure about Carol & John’s.

Peripheral type (JOHN SHEARER) resembles: [Ketchupa all caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105808/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/ketchupa_pro/)
“comic book shop” looks like Trade Gothic Bold Condensed.

Just emailed the designer [Mikey Burton](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105808/http:/www.mikeyburton.com/) (who does excellent work), and he said it is [Borgstand](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105808/http:/www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/borgstrand)

I thought the question was about COMIC BOOK SHOP, but good work on finding the other font.

- Mike Yanega
